Key Match Events: Cleveland showcased why it is the top team in the NBA, leading by as much as 16 points against the home team.
The Lakers stormed back and cut the lead to three, 30-33, after a floater by LeBron James.
Cleveland maintained separation as they started the fourth with a 9-2 run to push the lead to 16, 96-80, after a triple by Georges Niang.
Back-to-back-to-back shots by Jarrett Allen kept Los Angeles at bay, 118-107, with 1:28 remaining, closing the door on the comeback.
Post-Match Reflections: Jarrett Allen posted a double-double of 27 points and 14 rebounds to go with three blocks, an assist and a steal.
Donovan Mitchell added 26 markers on 8-of-20 shooting, including 6-of-13 from the 3-pointer.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Evan Mobley added 20 points and six rebounds for Cleveland.
Max Strus and Darius Garland had 15 and 14, respectively.
Others: Austin Reaves had a near triple-double of 35 points, 10 assists and nine rebounds.
Anthony Davis chipped in 28 markers and 13 boards, while James scored 23.
